{{Infobox airport | name = RAF Full Sutton | nativename = [[Image:Ensign of the Royal Air Force.svg|90px]] | nativename-a = | nativename-r = | image = | image-width = | caption = | IATA = | ICAO = | type = Military | owner = | operator = [[Royal Air Force]] | city-served = | location = [[Full Sutton]], [[East Riding of Yorkshire]] | built = 1943 | used = 1944-1963 | elevation-f = {{Convert|16|m|disp=output number only|0}} | elevation-m = 16 | coordinates = {{Coord|53|58|47|N|000|51|53|W|region:GB_type:airport|display=inline,title}} | latd = 53 | latm = 58 | lats = 47 | latNS = N | longd= 000 | longm= 51 | longs= 53 | longEW= W | coordinates_type = airport | coordinates_region = GB | pushpin_map = East Riding of Yorkshire | pushpin_label = RAF Full Sutton | pushpin_map_caption = Location in the East Riding of Yorkshire | website = | r1-number = 00/00 | r1-length-f = 0 | r1-length-m = 0 | r1-surface = [[Asphalt]] | r2-number = 00/00 | r2-length-f = 0 | r2-length-m = 0 | r2-surface = Asphalt | r3-number = 00/00 | r3-length-f = 0 | r3-length-m = 0 | r3-surface = Asphalt | stat-year = | stat1-header = | stat1-data = | stat2-header = | stat2-data = | footnotes = }} '''Royal Air Force Station Full Sutton''' or '''RAF Full Sutton''' is a former [[Royal Air Force]] station located {{Convert|2.0|mi}} south east of [[Stamford Bridge, East Riding of Yorkshire|Stamford Bridge]], [[East Riding of Yorkshire]] and {{Convert|4.7|mi}} north west of [[Pocklington]], East Riding of Yorkshire, [[England]].
==History==
The airfield opened in 1944 under [[RAF Bomber Command]], with [[No. 77 Squadron RAF]] which arrived at RAF Full Sutton on 15 May 1944 with the [[Handley Page Halifax]] Mks III and VI, switching to the [[Douglas C-47 Skytrain|Dakota]] in July 1945. The squadron moved to [[RAF Broadwell]] on 31 August 1945.<ref name="Jefford2001p84">{{Harvnb|Jefford|2001|p=84.}}</ref>
RAF Full Sutton was switched to [[RAF Transport Command]] being used by a flight of [[No. 231 Squadron RAF]] between 1 December 1945 and 15 January 1946 operating the [[Avro Lancastrian]] C.2 before being disbanded.<ref name="Jefford2001p74">{{Harvnb|Jefford|2001|p=74.}}</ref>
In the 1950s it was part of Flying Training Command, as 103 FRS and then as 207 AFS
The airfield was then placed on care and maintenance until 1959 when [[No. 102 Squadron RAF]] arrived and the airfield was re-modelled as a [[PGM-17 Thor|Thor missile]] site, operating until 27 April 1963.<ref name="CT">{{cite web|url=http://www.controltowers.co.uk/F/Full_Sutton.htm |title=RAF Full Sutton airfield |publisher=Control Towers|accessdate=20 June 2012}}</ref><ref name="Jefford2001p54">{{Harvnb|Jefford|2001|p=54.}}</ref>
